course.subject: PHYS
course.name: Methods of Experimental Physics II
course.description: This course will cover the techniques of experimental physics in the area of optics. Students will complete experiments involving basic optical systems, interferometry, waveguides and optical fibers, optical spectroscopy, semiconductor laser diodes, microwave reflection, scattering and diffraction.
course.prerequisites: (PHYS 1114 OR PHYS 1314) AND PHYS 2023

reviews.author: 小龜
reviews.title: 這是一個Lab Course的分水嶺
reviews.comment_content:
PHYS1113,PHYS1115,PHYS2023 都是一類型的lab，PHYS3152/PHYS3153 是另一個類型的lab course。

我就列一下不同的地方：
1. Lab自己做
2. 沒有填充
3. Take data時哪裡需要密一點疏一點自己決定，決定前先想想你result要做什麼analysis,。這個不一定變得快就take得密一點的。這個要耐心...
4. 要寫Labnote


format:
一個Lab做兩個星期，每一個星期去兩次lab。每個lab有兩至三個sub-task，所以基本去一次lab做完一個sub-task就差不多。

特別說一下optics。你這個lab data漂亮不漂亮基本取決于你alignment做的好不好，如果alignment差你在變換距離後可能什麼也看不到。
reviews.comment_teaching:
Teaching session:
每個lab一次teaching session，教theory，我那一年就Lortz在講。Powerpoint會upload上網不用擔心。那些東西寫Summary 的時候很重要，請確保真的明白，至少裝模作樣的能寫出來。
ps:這個有attendance requirement的

Lab session:
謹以此致Technician Eric和IA Tony

在lab能幫你的，不是instructor(我所在的LA2 ,負責的instructor從來沒有出現過，用Tony的話就是instructor很信任我們，嗯），不是TA,(TA估計是新來的PG, 沒有經驗，不要期望了），而是IA和Lab technician。
他們帶過很多年的lab，知道那些儀器應該怎麼用，你會遇到什麼問題，你那些data有沒有出錯。尤其是optics做alignment，如果你一次就上手我只能說你是天才，一般人還是找人教教吧...如果他們認為你behind schedule,他們會幫你做alignment的，當然performance分就可能有那麼一點影響...
reviews.comment_grading:
筆者因為一些很白癡的原因導致其中一個lab分數被打了九折，在這分數咬的很緊的lab course（大概3分一個sub-grade)結果就不要再說了。
我估計90%多一點就有A range了。Grade在lab來說算是一般吧。
reviews.comment_workload:
每個Lab交一份Lab note和Lab summary

Labnote:
整個course最重要的就是Labnote。你有幾樣東西需要寫：
1. Objective
2. Paraphrase procedures
3. Result
4. Discussion(Analysis+Question answering)
5. Conclusion (What you have learnt, 這部分我經常忘記）
建議去lab前先把procedure寫完，然後隨做實驗隨寫。

Lab summary:
這個基本和以前做開的lab summary 差不多
1. Background
2. Theories
3. Result and Discussion
這個result可以refer labnote的內容，不用再寫一次。
4. Conclusion

Lab  report:
這個沒什麼好說的，基本就是找一份Lab summary然後加上些圖，summary，citation之類的東西。不過占分還挺多的，修飾一下就行。

reviews.author: Lucien▪Evans
reviews.title: much better than 1000/2000 level
reviews.comment_content: Just attend the lab, complete the notebook and write 3 reports.
reviews.comment_teaching:
If you have a good relationship with your TA in lab session, you would find it easy to get a higher score.

Contents in lecture are easy but sometimes useful in the experiment.
reviews.comment_grading:
The scores in my memory (not very accurate):
lab notebook: in total around 9/10 (mean ~8?)
report: 92/100 (mean ~ 80+)
performance: 9+/10
Overall score:92~94
Attendance: Full
Grade: A+ (better than i expected, i thought 95 would be a cut-off)

As long as you spend efforts on every part, you will get a satisfactory score. The TA/IA won't focus on the details in your notebook/report.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is heavy if you want to get 90% score in every section. All assignments are not difficult but time-consuming.

Finding someone to take the lab together with you will significantly lighten the workload since you can discuss the problems in the notebook.

reviews.author: _NattU_
reviews.comment_content:
The course consists of 6-7 lectures and 6 experiments in total. Attend the lecture for attendance marks but I didn't find it particularly useful. The experiments are as follows:

O1. Basic Optical Systems
O2. Application of interferometry
O3. Waveguides and Optical Fibers
O4. Application of Optical Spectroscopy
O5. Semiconductor Laser Diodes
O6. Experiential Lab: Special Topics in Optical Physics

The experiments are fairly sophisticated and cover some interesting phenomena. You also get introduced to a whole new range of optical devices.

Because this was an online sem, the O6 lab was reduced to something very basic that you could do by yourself at home. For e.g. investigating interference patterns in water or between two speakers. You are free to design whatever experiment you want as long as it is closely related to optics.

You need to submit a lab notebook for each lab from O1 to O5.  O3 needs an additional lab report (worth 25% of the grade!). O6 only needs a report but is comparatively longer.
reviews.comment_teaching: As I said, I did not find the lectures particularly helpful. However, they do contain the theoretical background for the experiments and you may use some of that knowledge when answering questions from the lab manual.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading consists of the following components:

1) lab performance (25%)
2) lecture attendance (5%)
3) lab notebook (25%)
4) O3 report (25%)
5) O6 report (20%)

Since the lab was online, the TA asked us to provide instructions to setup the experiment and also asked us open-ended questions to assess our lab performance.

My overall score was 89% and I got an A. The average overall score was in the low 80s. I think you need a 90%+ for A+ and a score around mean will warrant a B+/ A- depending on the batch of students.
reviews.comment_workload: It can be pretty demanding since you need a lot of time to finish the lab notebooks. However, since the sem was in online mode, we could use Word or Latex to make our notebooks for a softcopy submission instead of the usual handwritten ones so that made things a bit easier. I normally allocated an entire day to finish the lab notebook.

reviews.author: varnaiyer
reviews.comment_content: The experiments covered in this course are rather modern and are well designed. Some aspects that may be overlooked during theoretical examination are carefully brought out in this course as part of the general observations.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Lortz provides a very clear structure in his presentations before the experiment. This enables one to watch out for technical details. The basic principles behind every experiment are not compiled in any one book which makes the presentations very informative and useful to attend. Another useful tip is to ask Tony (the IA) whenever you are stuck, he has all the answers and is extremely competent.
reviews.comment_grading: The TA's look for cohesiveness while grading the lab notebooks. Well labelled axes and detailed analyses is all it takes to get a good grade in this course. The summary required for the language course is graded based on format and informativeness.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload can be high for this course if one does not periodically update his lab notebook. Things tend to pileup and get out of hand if the majority of the work is left for final weeks. Lab time is quite adequate so it is alright to fumble and mess up a few first attempts!
